page.title: 04VEGETATION
page.content: As one would expect,the vegetation of the area varies with soil-type and altitude. The valley floors are mostly sandy and well-drained. Here the vegetation is mostly grass with smaller areas of whin and gorse and even some foxglove. As one walks higher up the valley sides the vegetation changes to bracken and heather with smaller areas of bog vegetation. Other flowers found in this region of 500- 1500' include foxglove, bedstraw, potentilla, vetch, cotton-grass and varied grasses. On the uppermost slopes the main vegetation is heather and tussocky grass. There are some areas of bog and associated plants but drainage is being carried out by farmers and forestry thus destroying large areas of bog-loving vegetation.
